newsitem.title: USA: PCA Int'l reinstates $0.07 qtly dividend.
newsitem.headline: PCA Int'l reinstates $0.07 qtly dividend.

text.p: PCA International Inc, an operator of retail portrait photo studios, said Wednesday its board has approved reinstatement of the company's $0.07 per share quarterly cash dividend.
The dividend will be payable on July 2 for shareholders of record as of June 11, the company said.
It said the decision to resume paying dividends was due to favorable results and positive operating trends in the first quarter of 1997, which were released today.
The PCA board suspended the dividend in December, citing financial requirements of its purchase of American Studios Inc.
The company said its board also authorized a $10 million prepayment of PCA's $65 million five-year term loan.
For the quarter ended May 4, PCA said that including the operations of American Studios, which it acquired in January, its sales rose 63 percent to $58.7 million from $36.1 million in the prior year.
It said net income for the latest quarter was $640,000 or $0.08 per share, compared with $1.1 million, or $0.14 per share, in the 1996 first quarter.
Earnings for the 1997 quarter were reduced by interest expense of $1.6 million and amortization of intangible assets of $500,000, both relating to the American Studios' acquisition, it said.
